english: Actions speak louder than words
literal: Deeds cry louder than words
context: What you do matters more than what you say

english: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
literal: Don't count chicks from eggs
context: Don't assume success before it happens

english: The early bird catches the worm
literal: The early riser enjoys wine
context: Being early/prompt brings advantages

english: You can't judge a book by its cover
literal: A book isn't learned by its cover
context: Don't judge based on appearances

english: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade
literal: Find good in what you're given
context: Make the best of difficult situations

english: Rome wasn't built in a day
literal: Rome wasn't built in one day
context: Important things take time to accomplish

english: Better late than never
literal: Late rather than never
context: It's better to do something late than not at all

english: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
georgian: ყველა კვერცხი ერთ კალათში ნუ ჩადებ
literal: Don't put all eggs in one basket
context: Don't risk everything on one opportunity

english: A picture is worth a thousand words
literal: One picture is worth a thousand words
context: Visual evidence is more powerful than description

english: The grass is always greener on the other side
literal: Neighbor's grass is always green
context: Other people's situations seem better than yours

english: Strike while the iron is hot
literal: Beat the anvil while it's hot
context: Take advantage of good opportunities immediately

english: Too many cooks spoil the broth
literal: Many cooks harm the soup
context: Too many people managing something ruins it

english: Where there's a will, there's a way
georgian: სადაც ნება არის, იქ გზაც არის
literal: Where there's will, there's also a path
context: Determination can overcome obstacles

english: You reap what you sow
literal: What you sow, that you'll harvest
context: Your actions determine your consequences

english: Patience is a virtue
literal: Patience is a virtue
context: Being patient is a valuable quality

english: Don't bite the hand that feeds you
literal: Don't bite the hand that feeds you
context: Don't harm those who help you

english: Honesty is the best policy
georgian: მართლა მთქმელს ქალაქიც კი არ წყალობს
literal: Even the city doesn't spare the truth-teller
context: Being honest is always the right approach (Georgian is ironic)

english: Knowledge is power
literal: Knowledge is power
context: Information and learning give you advantages

english: Practice makes perfect
literal: Practice melted the snow
context: Repeated practice leads to mastery

english: Money doesn't grow on trees
literal: Money doesn't grow on trees
context: Money is earned through work, not easily obtained

english: All that glitters is not gold
literal: What shines is not gold
context: Appearances can be deceiving

english: A penny saved is a penny earned
literal: A saved kopeck is an earned kopeck
context: Saving money is as valuable as earning it

english: Don't cry over spilled milk
literal: Don't cry over spilled milk
context: Don't waste time regretting past mistakes

english: Two heads are better than one
literal: Two heads are better than one
context: Collaboration often produces better results

english: The pen is mightier than the sword
literal: The pen is stronger than the sword
context: Words and ideas are more powerful than violence

english: Necessity is the mother of invention
literal: Necessity is the mother of invention
context: Need drives people to create solutions

english: Fortune favors the bold
literal: Fortune favors the brave
context: Taking risks can lead to success

english: Look before you leap
literal: Look, then jump
context: Think carefully before taking action

english: Time heals all wounds
literal: Time heals all wounds
context: Pain and problems diminish with time

english: What doesn't kill you makes you stronger
literal: What doesn't kill you, strengthens you
context: Overcoming difficulties builds resilience

english: Birds of a feather flock together
literal: Similar ones get used to similar ones
context: People with similar interests/values associate together

english: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
literal: Don't make the calf drink milk
context: Don't assume success before it happens

english: When in Rome, do as the Romans do
literal: In someone else's house, by someone else's rules
context: Adapt to local customs when visiting places

english: The squeaky wheel gets the grease
literal: A barking dog gets a bone
context: Making noise gets attention and results

english: Better safe than sorry
literal: Better to be safe than regret
context: It's wise to be cautious to avoid problems

english: Absence makes the heart grow fonder
literal: Far away was the beloved
context: Being apart increases love and appreciation

english: A stitch in time saves nine
literal: A timely drop didn't make a hole
context: Fixing problems early prevents bigger issues

english: Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today
georgian: რასაც დღეს შეძლებ, ხვალ ნუ გადადებ
literal: What you can do today, don't postpone until tomorrow
context: Don't procrastinate on important tasks

english: Every cloud has a silver lining
literal: Every cloud has a silver edge
context: Every bad situation has some good aspect

english: The devil is in the details
literal: The devil is in the details
context: Small details can cause big problems
